definition: France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: It may be fascism, or barbarism.
sentences.chinese: 那可能是法西斯主義，或暴力主義。

sentences.english: What they really want is a one-party fascist dictatorship.
sentences.chinese: 他們實際上要的是法西斯主義的一黨專政。

sentences.english: They also thought that only the Soviet Union would be powerful enough to defeat Fascism.
sentences.chinese: 他們還認爲蘇聯是能夠戰勝法西斯主義的唯一力量。

sentences.english: When fascism comes to America, it will come wrapped in an America flag.
sentences.chinese: ‘法西斯主義登陸美國時，總會包着一面美國旗。’

sentences.english: It opens on the narrow path toward racial fascism.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的定義，開闢了通向種族法西斯主義的狹路。

sentences.english: A one-party state can be the start of the slippery slopetowards fascism.
sentences.chinese: 一黨專政有可能是滑向法西斯主義的起點。

sentences.english: Fascism had lawlessly overthrown the democratic government of this country.
sentences.chinese: 法西斯主義非法推翻了這個國家的民主政府。

sentences.english: The old man was seized with burning hatred for the fascists.
sentences.chinese: 老人對法西斯主義者充滿了仇恨。

sentences.english: She has a profound hatred of fascism.
sentences.chinese: 她對法西斯主義懷有深仇大恨。

sentences.english: Fascism cannot save capitalism, but only hastens its destruction.
sentences.chinese: 法西斯主義救不了資本主義，而只會加快其滅亡。

sentences.english: The people struggled together against fascism.
sentences.chinese: 人們齊心與法西斯主義作鬥爭。

sentences.english: Due to its(peculiarity) in creation, it is undoubtedly a masterpiece of anti-fascism literature after the World War II.
sentences.chinese: 反法西斯主義是德國文學長寫不衰的一大主題。

sentences.english: Fascism was on the march in Germany and Italy.
sentences.chinese: 法西斯主義在德國和意大利興起。

sentences.english: Anti-fascism is one everlasting theme in German literature.
sentences.chinese: 反法西斯主義是德國文學長寫不衰的一大主題。

sentences.english: Top4 Money-hungry fascists are dead inside.
sentences.chinese: 金錢飢渴的法西斯主義者們內心腐朽。

definition: Marshal Josip Broz Tito (1892-1980), Yugoslav military and communist political leader, president of Yugoslavia 1945-1980
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
General Douglas MacArthur (1880-1964), US commander in Pacific during WW2, sacked in 1951 by President Truman for exceeding orders during the Korean war
